reviewText: Comedian Eric Kot got Wong Kar-wei's blessing (and his hugely talented cinematographer, Australian Christopher Doyle) for what begins as a parody of the Wong's multi-story tales of love and longing (see Chungking Express and Fallen Angels) but which emerges as an hilariously unhinged examination of the creative process. It's a shame Kot, who at the time was the closest thing Hong Kong had to Jim Carrey, never got more chances to direct. First Love is his valentine to the possibilities of movie-making.
